ovdesc.p: This screen is used to setup generic settings for clearings used in payments hub as per Clearing,Currency and MessagePaymentType combination.
A record authorised in this screen will create or amend or delete a record in store table, PPT.CLEARINGSETTING

desc.p: Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
Indicates whether manual verification is required before proceeding with processing the payment through the clearing.
Example: For The bank in UK - BACS clearing – Direct Debit: The manual verification indicator will be set to "Y".
Indicates the direction of the message with respect to the payments hub.
Refers to type of payment message.
Mandatory field. Value in this field links to field 'MessagePaymentType' PPT.MSGPAYMENTTYPE.
Used for internal purpose. Holds the ID of the previous live record of store table.
This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters and the value is not editable by the user.

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.

This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.
Indicates whether the settlement transaction for the total amount of the clearing direct debit file must be created during de-bulking of individual transactions.
Bank in UK - BACS clearing – Direct Debit: The Settlement Booking indicator will be set to "N"

"Y" indicates the total amount of the clearing file is pre settled and the settlement transaction must be created at the time of de bulking .This will result in creation of addition transaction in addition to the sum
of individual payments during de bulking.

"N" indicates the clearing file total amount is not pre-settled or it is pre-settled and the bank prefers to create the settlement transaction for the successful payments at a pre-specified time later.
Indicates the number of days to be added(plus) or subtracted(minus) to the processing date to arrive at the value date of the settlement and the individual transactions.
This date is applicable only if the processing date is present in the file.

Example: In certain cases clearing takes a day or two to settle the payment before it can be available to the beneficiary. This holds true for OUR correspondents which are operating in another time zone and can process out payments next day only (JPY).
It specifies if validations are required or not for that clearing.
It can take the values: Y or N.
If it is set to Y, the table PPT.ClearingValidations must be checked to retrieve the ValidationAPI.
